te:

> Rich,
> I don't have a lot of personal experience with Akao work, bu=
t my 
> understanding is that the later generations did some work in iron, =

> although not as much.  Also, while the first two generations started 
> =
working in copper alloy after leaving Echizen, I don't think that they 
> s=
topped making iron tsuba.  FWIW, I have an iron sukashi guard signed 
> Kof=
u ju Akao Yoshitsugu.  This would probably be the third generation 
> or la=
ter.  Your kanji for the nidai signature did not come out for 
> me.  Sorti=
ng out generations from the signatures without personal 
> names is not str=
aightforward. 
>
> Jim
>
>
>   All, does anyone know if the Akao smith Yosh=
itsugu ( Shodai and Nidai )
>   was the only smith of this group ( 9 genera=
tions I think ) that worked
>   in tetsu ?. I see the 1st and the 2nd Yoshi=
tsugu worked in Shakudo
>   Sukashi after they moved to Edo, but worked in =
iron whilst in Echizen.
>   Did any of the other 7 Yoshitsugu's work in Iro=
n, or were they all in
>   Shakudo and Shibuichi plate.
>
>   Also, I see t=
he Nidai signed ???? ( Akao Yoshitsugu if the kanji does

, did any other of the group sign this way ?.
